description:
Le document du plan participatif d’aménagement de la Forêt classée d’Assimé (CFA) dont est issu ce tableau est initié en 2010 par le ministère de l’environnement et des ressources forestières gestion avec l’appui technique de l’ONG JVE International dans le cadre du projet de restauration et de gestion participative de la Forêt classée d’Assimé afin d’évaluer les potentialités de la forêt en tenant compte des résultats des études réalisées.
La flore désigne l’ensemble des espèces végétales présentes dans un lieu. Elle désigne aussi un livre dans lequel les espèces sont listées. Les inventaires ont identifié 167 espèces ligneuses (dbh ≥ 2,5 cm) dans la Forêt Classée d’Assimé (FCA). Ces espèces sont réparties selon les types d’écosystèmes avec 62 espèces dans la forêt semi-décidus.
title: BID-AF2015-0004-NAC Listes des espèces et familles recensées dans les  forêts semi-décidues de terre ferme de la FCA au Togo.

publishingOrganization.title: Direction des Ressources Forestières (DRF)

hostingOrganization.title: Université de Lomé
hostingOrganization.description: The University of Lomé (previously called University of Benin, founded 1970) is located in Lomé Tokoin Campus.  The University of  Lomé has schools of humanities and science and a university institute of technology. A school of architecture and town planning, also at Lomé, was founded in 1975 by the African and Mauritian Common Organization (OCAM).

La flore désigne l’ensemble des espèces végétales présentes dans un lieu. Elle désigne aussi un livre dans lequel les espèces sont listées. Les inventaires ont identifié 167 espèces ligneuses (dbh ≥ 2,5 cm) dans la Forêt Classée d’Assimé (FCA). Ces espèces sont réparties selon les types d’écosystèmes avec 47 espèces dans la forêt claire.

description: This dataset contains the digitized treatments in Plazi based on the original journal article Dursun, Ahmet, Fent, Meral (2017): Annotated Checklist of Tingidae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) in Turkey with new records for the faunas of Europe and Turkish Thrace. description: The Wallace Herbarium is part of the Eurobodalla Regional Botanic Garden near Batemans Bay. Established in 1987 by Dr Murray Wallace, the herbarium also incorporated earlier collections from regional offices of NSW State Forests and NSW NPWS.
title: ERBG AVH data

publishingOrganization.title: Atlas of Living Australia
publishingOrganization.description: The Atlas of Living Australia (Atlas) contains information on all the known species in Australia aggregated from a wide range of data providers: museums, herbaria, community groups, government departments, individuals and universities.

description:
Former National Rivers Authority paper records for river corridor surveys of the River Blackwater in Essex, held by the Environment Agency and digitised by Essex Wildlife Trust on their behalf using funding from the NBN data capture initiative. Data consists mainly of botanical records from old recording cards, although there are some records for other taxa.
 
 Paper copies of these surveys are held by Essex Biodiversity Project, scanned copies of the site descriptions and sketch maps accompanying this data are held digitally by Essex Wildlife Trust Biological Records Centre.
publishingOrganizationTitle: Essex Wildlife Trust Biological Records Centre
title: River Blackwater historic river corridor surveys

publishingOrganization.title: Essex Wildlife Trust Biological Records Centre
publishingOrganization.description: Essex Wildlife Trust Records Centre collates and manages biological records to promote data sharing in Essex.

hostingOrganization.title: National Biodiversity Network
hostingOrganization.description: The National Biodiversity Network is a collaborative partnership created to exchange biodiversity information.  It is a charity, with a membership including many UK wildlife conservation organisations, government, country agencies, environmental agencies, local environmental records centres and many voluntary groups.

description:
This dataset contains species records for Sepsidae species covered by the recording scheme, and that have been verified by the recording scheme. Records are from datasets made available via the iRecord verification process - these records may originate from direct addition of records to iRecord, or via other datasets that have been added to iRecord for verification purposes.
Additional_information
title: Sepsidae Recording Scheme - records verified via iRecord

publishingOrganization.title: Dipterists Forum
publishingOrganization.description:
With over 7,000 species the order Diptera is the largest in the UK. The enormous range of habitats, appearances, biology, behaviours and ease of identification has resulted in the development of numerous groups to study and record them. In an effort to share experiences and provide mutual support, the Dipterists Forum was formed and now conducts field meetings & workshops and publishes a biannual Bulletin and a journal, Dipterists Digest. Within this umbrella organisation are up to 28 different Study Groups and Recording Schemes. Some operate more or less independently, others under the Dipterists Forum banner and all have the continued support of BRC. A full list of these may be found on our website.

The published resources listed below are managed directly by Dipterists Forum.

For membership and access to publishing, contact John Showers at showersjohn@gmail.com

hostingOrganization.title: National Biodiversity Network
hostingOrganization.description: The National Biodiversity Network is a collaborative partnership created to exchange biodiversity information.  It is a charity, with a membership including many UK wildlife conservation organisations, government, country agencies, environmental agencies, local environmental records centres and many voluntary groups.

description: This dataset contains the digitized treatments in Plazi based on the original journal article Bunwong, Sukhonthip, Chantaranothai, Pranom, Keeley, Sterling C. (2014): Revisions and key to the Vernonieae (Compositae) of Thailand. PhytoKeys 37: 25-101, DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.3897/phytokeys.37.6499, URL: http://dx.doi.org/10.3897/phytokeys.37.6499
title: Revisions and key to the Vernonieae (Compositae) of Thailand
